required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A First-In-Human Study With a Single Dose UCB4019 in Healthy Volunteers
clinical_study.official_title: A Subject-Blind, Investigator-Blind, Randomized, Placebo-Controlled, First-In-Human Study Evaluating the Safety, Pharmacokinetics, and Pharmacodynamics of Single Ascending Subcutaneous Doses of UCB4019 in Healthy Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: This study is designed to evaluate the safety and tolerability of single ascending doses of UCB4019 administered by subcutaneous injection in healthy subjects.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of treatment emergent adverse events during the study
primary_outcome.description: An AE is any untoward medical occurrence in a subject or trial subject that is administered a drug or biologic (medicinal product) or that is using a medical device. The event does not necessarily have a causal relationship with that treatment or usage.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pharmacokinetic samples will be taken predose, immediately after the end of infusion, 4, 6, 8, 12, 24, 36, 48, 72, and 96 hours postdose and Days 7, 10, 13, 16, 19

secondary_outcome.measure: Area under the curve from 0 to time t, the time of last quantifiable concentration [(AUC0-t)]
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pharmacokinetic samples will be taken predose, immediately after the end of infusion, 4, 6, 8, 12, 24, 36, 48, 72, and 96 hours postdose and Days 7, 10, 13, 16, 19
Pharmacokinetic samples will be taken predose, immediately after the end of infusion, 4, 6, 8, 12, 24, 36, 48, 72, and 96 hours postdose and Days 7, 10, 13, 16, 19

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in total Immunoglobulin G (IgG) concentration at day 7
Change from Baseline in total Immunoglobulin G (IgG) concentration at day 10
Change from Baseline in total Immunoglobulin G (IgG) concentration at day 13

arm_group.description: Single dose placebo comparator for each active arm
Dose 1 calculated based on body weight
Dose 2 calculated based on body weight
Dose 3 calculated based on body weight
Dose 4 calculated based on body weight

intervention.description: Active substance: UCB4019 Route of Administration: subcutaneously
Active substance: Placebo Concentration: 0.9 % saline Route of Administration: subcutaneously

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Good physical and mental health
- At least 18 and less than 65 years of age
- Female subjects of childbearing potential must agree to use a highly effective method of birth control, during the study and for a period of 3 months after their last dose of study drug
Exclusion Criteria:
- Total Immunoglobulin G <7 g/L or >16 g/L at the Screening Visit
- Absolute neutrophil count <1.5x10^9/L and/or lymphocyte count <1.0x10^9/L
- Known viral hepatitis, has a positive test for Hepatitis B surface antigen or is Hepatitis C virus antibody positive
- Positive test to Human Immunodeficiency Virus (HIV) 1/2 antibodies
- Past medical history or family history of primary immunodeficiency
- Evidence of latent/active Tuberculosis (TB)
- Active infection or a serious infection within 6 weeks before the first dose of IMP
- Renal impairment
- Hepatic impairment
- Vaccination within 6 weeks before the Screening Visit or intent to have a vaccination before Day 43 of the Safety Follow-up Period
- Subject is splenectomized
- received any IMP or experimental procedure within 90 days before the first dose of IMP
- received UCB7665 in a clinical study
